name: robotcode
description: RobotFramework support for Visual Studio Code

semanticTokenModifiers.description: built in library, keyword or variable

robotcode.python.description: Specifies the python executable to be used for RobotCode. If no path is specified, try to get it from "python" extension. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.editor.4SpacesTab.description: If actived insert 4 spaces if TAB is pressed.

robotcode.languageServer.mode.description: Specifies the mode the language server is started. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.languageServer.tcpPort.description: If the port is specified, connect to the language server previously started at the given port. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.languageServer.args.markdownDescription: Specifies the arguments to be passed to the language server (i.e.: [`--log`, `--log-file=~/robotcode.log`]). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.debugAdapter.mode.description: Specifies the mode the debug adapter is started. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.debugAdapter.tcpPort.description: If the port is specified, connect to the debug adapter previously started at the given port. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.debugAdapter.host.description: If the host is specified, connect to the debug adapter previously started at the given host. Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.debugAdapter.args.markdownDescription: Specifies the arguments to be passed to the debug adapter (i.e.: [`--log`, `--log-file=~/debug-adapter.log`]). Requires a VSCode restart to take effect.

robotcode.robot.args.description: Specifies the arguments to be passed to robot.

robotcode.robot.paths.markdownDescription: Specifies the paths where robot/robotcode should discover tests. Corresponds to the `paths` option of __robot__.

robotcode.robot.pythonPath.markdownDescription: Specifies additional python paths for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--pythonpath` option of __robot__.

robotcode.robot.env.description: Specifies the environment variables for robotframework.

robotcode.robot.languages.markdownDescription: Specifies the supported language(s) that can be used to write _robot_ files. Corresponds to the `--language lang *` option of __robot__.

robotcode.robot.variables.markdownDescription: Specifies the variables for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--variable name:value` option of __robot__.

robotcode.robot.variableFiles.markdownDescription: Specifies the variable files for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--variablefile` option of __robot__.

robotcode.robot.outputDir.markdownDescription: Specifies the output directory where robotframework saves output files. Corresponds to the `--outputdir` option of __robot__.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Mode is got from test/task header in data files.
Turn on the generic automation mode. Corresponds to the `--rpa` option of __robot__.
Force test automation mode. Corresponds to the `--norpa` option of __robot__.
robotcode.robot.mode.markdownDescription: Specifies robot execution mode. Corresponds to the `--rpa` or `--norpa` option of __robot__.

enumDescriptions: Save cached data into workspace folder.
Save cached data into workspace storage.
robotcode.analysis.cache.saveLocation.description: Specifies where cached data is saved.

robotcode.analysis.cache.ignoredLibrarie.markdownDescription:
Specifies the library names that should not be cached. This is useful if you have a dynamic or hybrid library that has different keywords depending on the arguments. You can specify a glob pattern that matches the library name or the source file. 

Examples:
- `**/mylibfolder/mylib.py`
- `MyLib`
- `mylib.subpackage.subpackage` 

For robot framework internal libraries, you have to specify the full module name like `robot.libraries.Remote`.

If you change this setting, you may need to run the command `Robot Code: Clear Cache and Restart Language Servers`.

robotcode.analysis.cache.ignoredVariable.markdownDescription:
Specifies the variable files that should not be cached. This is useful if you have a dynamic or hybrid variable files that has different variables depending on the arguments. You can specify a glob pattern that matches the variable module name or the source file. 

Examples:
- `**/variables/myvars.py`
- `MyVariables`
- `myvars.subpackage.subpackage` 

If you change this setting, you may need to run the command `Robot Code: Clear Cache and Restart Language Servers`.

robotcode.run.openOutputAfterRun.description: Defines if the report or log file should be opened after a run.

robotcode.debug.defaultConfiguration.description: Specifies the default configuration to run or debug robot tests.

robotcode.debug.attachPython.description: Attach also the python debugger if a robot test starts.

robotcode.debug.outputMessages.description: Output messages from robotframework in debug console.

robotcode.debug.outputLog.description: Output log messages from robotframework in debug console.

robotcode.debug.outputTimestamps.description: Include timestamps in log and output messages.

robotcode.debug.groupOutput.description: Group start and stop suite/test/keyword messages in debug console.

robotcode.debug.useExternalDebugpy.description: Use the debugpy in python environment, not from the python extension.

enumDescriptions: No terminal (pipes the output to the client debug console).
robotcode.debug.defaultConsole.description: Default setting for where to launch the debug target: internal console, integrated terminal, or external terminal.

robotcode.robocop.enabled.markdownDescription: Enables 'robocop' code analysis, if installed. See [robocop](https://github.com/MarketSquare/robotframework-robocop)

robotcode.robocop.include.description: Include specified 'robocop' rules. You can define rule by its name or id. Glob patterns are supported

robotcode.robocop.exclude.description: Exlude specified 'robocop' rules. You can define rule by its name or id. Glob patterns are supported

robotcode.robotidy.enabled.markdownDescription: Enables 'robotidy' code formatting, if installed. See [robotidy](https://github.com/MarketSquare/robotframework-tidy)

robotcode.analysis.findUnusedReferences.markdownDescription: Find and reports unused keyword and variable references.

enumDescriptions: Analyzes and reports problems only on open files.
Analyzes and reports problems on all files in the workspace.
Show detailed progress messages. Displays the filenames that are currently being analyzed.

robotcode.workspace.excludePatterns.description: Specifies glob patterns for excluding files and folders from analysing by the language server.

robotcode.analysis.maxProjectFileCount.description: Specifies the maximum number of files for which diagnostics are reported for the whole project/workspace folder. Specifies 0 or less to disable the limit completely.

robotcode.analysis.referencesCodeLens.description: Enable/disable references CodeLens for RobotFramework files.

robotcode.documentationServer.startPort.description: Defines the start port for the documentation server. If the port is free, this port is used, otherwise a free port is searched for.

robotcode.documentationServer.endPort.description: Defines the endport for searching a free port for the documentation server.

robotcode.completion.filterDefaultLangua.markdownDescription: Filter default language (English) for completion if there is another language defined.

robotcode.completion.headerStyle.markdownDescription: Defines the header style format. If not defined ```*** {name} ***``` is used.

robotcode.inlayHints.parameterNames.markdownDescription: Enable/disable inlay hints for parameter names.

commands.title: Clear Cache and Restart Language Servers

connect.label: Attach by connecting to debugpy over a socket.

host.description: Hostname or IP address to connect to.
Hostname or IP address to connect to.

attachPython.description: Attach also the python debugger if a robot test starts.

pythonConfiguration.description: Defines a template for the python launch configuration.

target.markdownDescription: The `.robot` file or a folder containing `.robot` files to be launched.

paths.markdownDescription: Specifies the paths where robot should discover tests. Corresponds to the 'paths' option of __robot__.

args.description: Specifies additional command line arguments passed to robot.

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. Default is the root directory of the file (leave empty).

env.description: Environment variables defined as a key value pair.

enumDescriptions: No terminal (pipes the output to the client debug console).
console.description: Where to launch the debug target: internal console, integrated terminal, or external terminal.

dryRun.markdownDescription: Verifies test data and runs tests so that library keywords are not executed. Corresponds to the `--dryrun` option of __robot__.

python.description: Specifies the python interpreter to use. If not specified, the python interpreter defined for the extension is used.

robotPythonPath.markdownDescription: Specifies additional python paths for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--pythonpath` option of __robot__.

attachPython.description: Attach also the python debugger if a robot test starts.

pythonConfiguration.description: Defines a template for the python launch configuration.

languages.markdownDescription: Specifies the supported language(s) that can be used to write _robot_ files. Corresponds to the `--language lang *` option of __robot__.

variables.markdownDescription: Specifies the variables for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--variable name:value` option of __robot__.

variableFiles.markdownDescription: Specifies the variable files for robotframework. Corresponds to the `--variablefile path *` option of __robot__.

include.markdownDescription: Specifies the tags that should be included in test run. Corresponds to the `--include tag * ` option of __robot__.

exclude.markdownDescription: Specifies the tags that should be excluded in test run. Corresponds to the `--excluded tag *` option of __robot__.

launcherArgs.description: Extra command line arguments passed to launcher.

launcherTimeout.description: Timeout the launcher waits for the debuggee.

debuggerArgs.description: Extra command line arguments passed to debugger.

debuggerTimeout.description: Timeout the debugger waits for a client connection.

outputDir.markdownDescription: Specifies the output directory where robotframework saves output files. Corresponds to the `--outputdir` option of __robot__.

outputMessages.description: Output messages from robotframework in debug console.

outputLog.description: Output log messages from robotframework in debug console.

outputTimestamps.description: Include timestamps in log and output messages.

groupOutput.description: Group start and stop suite/test/keyword messages in debug console.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Mode is got from test/task header in data files.
Turn on the generic automation mode. Corresponds to the `--rpa` option of __robot__.
Force test automation mode. Corresponds to the `--norpa` option of __robot__.

enumDescriptions: Use this configuration as default for all other configurations.
Use this configuration when running or debugging tests.
purpose.description: Defines what purpose this configuration has.
